name: ela
body: |- wb(wcel(c0, cat), wa(wcel(c0, cch), wbr(c0h, ccv, c0)))

stmt.origin: elrab2(hs0, c0, cat, cch, wbr(c0h, ccv, c0), wbr(c0h, ccv, cv(hs0)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, cat), wa(wcel(c0, cch), wbr(c0h, ccv, c0)))

-| diffsc(hs0, c0)
-| diffsc(hs0, cch)
-| diffsw(hs0, wbr(c0h, ccv, c0))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ HAtoms ↔(c0 ∈ CH ∧ 0H[<oH]c0))
⊣ (hs0 = c0 →(0H[<oH]hs0 ↔ 0H[<oH]c0))
⊣ HAtoms = { hs0 ∈ CH | 0H[<oH]hs0 }
⊣ d(hs0, c0)
⊣ d(hs0, CH)
⊣ d(hs0, 0H[<oH]c0)

comment: Atoms in a Hilbert lattice are the elements that cover the zero subspace. Definition of atom in [Kalmbach] p. 15. (Contributed by NM, 9-Jun-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)
